title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4208.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4208.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Corporation
shall mean the New York State Urban Development Corporation, a public benefit
corporation created by chapter 174 of the Laws of 1968, as amended. (b) Incubator building shall mean a facility
developed in order to provide affordable rent and shared office support
services to a number of new and small businesses. (c) Industrial firm shall mean a
manufacturing firm involved with extracting, smelting, recovering, developing, preparing, compounding, converting, assembling or producing in any manner, minerals, raw materials, products or substances of any kind or nature, and
shall include facilities related thereto for storage, warehousing or
distribution, for research and development or for the discovery of new, and the
refinement of known, substances, processes and products. (d) Industrial park shall mean a parcel or
assembly of land, developed according to a comprehensive plan, to provide
development sites and/or facilities for business and industrial uses. (e) Program shall mean the Industrial

Effectiveness Expansion, Retention and Attraction Assistance Program created by
section 7(b)(3) of the Omnibus Economic Development Act of 1987, chapter 839 of
the Laws of 1987, as amended. (f) Project loans shall mean loans made by the corporation pursuant to the
program. (g) State shall mean the

State of New York. (h) UDC Act shall
mean chapter 174 of the Laws of 1968, as amended. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4208.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
